laboratory_examinations.findings: Initially positive; nasopharyngeal swab: Neg, Pos, Pos, Pos, Inc, Inc, Inc, Pos, Neg, Inc, Neg (Ct 25.1–39.4), oropharyngeal swab: Pos, Pos, Pos, Pos, Pos, Pos, Pos, Neg, Neg, Neg, Neg, Neg (Ct 26.7–38.7), sputum: Pos (Ct 31.7–32.8).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Nasal swab changed from positive to negative, indicating decreasing viral load over time; Ct values increased to >35 in follow-up tests from days 12 onward, indicating lower viral RNA concentration.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive results confirmed for oropharyngeal swab and sputum specimens.
Nasopharyngeal and oropharyngeal specimens tested negative for SARS-CoV-2.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: First negative tests were confirmed at two consecutive time points, 14 days after symptom resolution.
